meanings.definition: Having a particular kind of nature or disposition.
meanings.sent1: She is a kind-natured person who always helps others.
meanings.sent2: The dog was friendly-natured and loved to play with everyone.
meanings.sent3: The cat, being mischievous-natured, knocked over the vase.
meanings.sent4: His adventurous-natured spirit led him to explore unknown lands.
meanings.sent5: The sunflower, being sun-loving-natured, thrived in the bright sunlight.

meanings.definition: Having a specified kind of nature.
meanings.sent1: The flower was brightly-natured, with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent2: The child was curious-natured, always asking questions.
meanings.sent3: The tree, being tall-natured, provided shade for the picnic.
meanings.sent4: Her artistic-natured talent shone through her paintings.
meanings.sent5: The bird, being migratory-natured, flew south for the winter.

meanings.definition: Having a temperament of a specified kind.
meanings.sent1: He was calm-natured, never getting angry easily.
meanings.sent2: The horse was gentle-natured, perfect for children to ride.
meanings.sent3: The storm, being fierce-natured, raged through the night.
meanings.sent4: Her competitive-natured drive pushed her to win the race.
meanings.sent5: The puppy, being playful-natured, chased its tail in circles.
